clip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a small metal or plastic object that holds or fastens things together
clip.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The wire is held on with a metal clip.
a wad of money in a gold clip
clip.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a short part of a film or television programme that is shown by itself, especially as an advertisement
clip.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: clips from the new James Bond film
clip.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a container for bullets which passes them quickly into the gun so that they can be fired
clip.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the act of cutting something to make it shorter or tidier
clip.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I gave the hedge a clip.
clip.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: an article that is cut from a newspaper or magazine for a particular reason
clip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to fasten something together or to be fastened together using a clip
clip.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a stack of bills clipped together
A microphone was clipped to his tie.
clip.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to cut small amounts of something in order to make it tidier
clip.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The hedges had just been clipped.
clip.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to cut an article or picture from a newspaper, magazine etc
clip.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: a cartoon clipped from a Minneapolis newspaper
clip.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to hit something quickly at an angle, often by accident
clip.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: A truck swerved and clipped a parked car.
clip.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to slightly reduce an amount, quantity etc â€“ used in news reports
clip.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Gunnell clipped a second off the world record.
clip.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to make a hole in a bus or train ticket to show that it has been used
